description: This course explores the origins of the modern Russian empire. Using primary sources such as chronicles, folktales, legal codes, letters, and religious icons, students consider Russia's development from a loose collection of princedoms to a powerful, multi-ethnic empire spanning 11 time zones. Topics include the impact of geography and climate, the Orthodox religion, Mongol rule, gender roles, the rise of autocracy, and social rebellion. Taught frequently.
name: Making Modern Russia
title: The Making of Modern Russia
